main event: On August 12th, 1959 in Elburn, Illinois, a civilian pilot observed three or four objects for 3 to 5 seconds, which seemed to form into one before disappearing. They appeared the size of a pea at arm's length.
interesting points: The objects appeared to be a string of lights that collected into one before disappearing.
The witness estimated the duration of the sighting to be 3-5 seconds and was fairly certain about this.
The event took place during a period of dull or just a trace of daylight.
The objects were observed during bright daylight without any noticeable sound.
The witness was an Airline Pilot with technical training, and the report was for research purposes, regarded as confidential.
sighted object: three or four objects that seemed to form into one before disappearing
